intro: Myginda theoides, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance. The plant has hairy, broad leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Myginda theoides is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
